abstract: A sense of gloom gripped Washington as the Federal Reserve chairman warned of the risks of a slowdown.
snippet: A sense of gloom gripped Washington as the Federal Reserve chairman warned of the risks of a slowdown.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — A sense of economic gloom gripped Washington on Tuesday as President Bush urged Americans not to lose faith, the Federal Reserve chairman offered a mostly bleak assessment of the difficulties ahead for the economy, and the administration’s latest effort to help the housing sector faced tough questioning in Congress.

headline.main: Fed Chief Bleak on Economic Outlook
headline.print_headline: PLAN TO RESCUE MORTGAGE GIANTS FACES RESISTANCE

abstract: The Fed chief warned of the risks of a long slowdown and higher inflation as the president, speaking nearby, said the country’s economic pillars remained sound.
snippet: The Fed chief warned of the risks of a long slowdown and higher inflation as the president, speaking nearby, said the country’s economic pillars remained sound.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  Warning of the risks of a further slowdown and higher inflation, Ben S. Bernanke, chairman of the Federal Reserve, offered a gloomy assessment of the economy on Tuesday as President Bush, speaking a few blocks away, urged Americans to have faith in the country’s financial foundation.

headline.main: Bernanke Is Pessimistic, but Bush Urges a ‘Deep Breath’
headline.print_headline: Pessimistic Words to Congress From Bernanke
